poem:
**Celebrity Vibes**

In the shimmer of stars—  
election whispers,  
a toss-up dances  
on glittered tongues.  
  
Names like jewels,  
JLo, Beyoncé—  
mirrors for democracy,  
where truth bends  
  
in the sway  
of distant,  
distracting light—  
a gleam, a guess,  
  
lost in the echo  
of their resplendent  
adornments.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From JLo to Beyoncé: the double-edged sword of celebrity endorsements The 2024 presidential election is, as best as anyone can tell from the inexact art of polling, essentially a toss-up. No one knows who is going to win on Tuesday (and we probably won’t know for a while afterwards, for that matter). In lieu of any definitive edge in numbers, both prognosticators and casual observers are resorting to vibes – that amorphous, indefinable and personal". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: From JLo to Beyoncé: the double-edged sword of celebrity endorsements The 2024 presidential election is, as best as anyone can tell from the inexact art of polling, essentially a toss-up. No one knows who is going to win on Tuesday (and we probably won’t know for a while afterwards, for that matter). In lieu of any definitive edge in numbers, both prognosticators and casual observers are resorting to vibes – that amorphous, indefinable and personal
